text:
Consider changing non-GUI mode so that it does not load any GUI classes.

This means changing the Save service XML aliasing.

Also need to change the class searching to skip GUI classes somehow - can this 
be done via the path name?

If this can't be done, one could perhaps change the relevant GUI classes so 
that screen items are not created statically?
creator: sebb@apache.org
richard_hubbe11@yahoo.com
text:
Does this problem cause non-gui startup to try to connect to an X server on
linux when starting in non-gui mode?

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
SaveService has been recoded so it no longer loads classes merely to establish 
aliases. This is in SVN and will be in the next release.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> Does this problem cause non-gui startup to try to connect to an X server on
> linux when starting in non-gui mode?

No idea, but it has been fixed anyway.

It's in the current nightlies, if you want to try that.
